_8OoJ8y__6DJB_nHJe3Xjw.text: Beautiful spacious coffee shop. Got the PA Cubano and it was delicious. The front of the shop is a windows that they open when it's nice out. Unfortunately, it was on the cold side today so they were closed up. The place was packed. The coffee was delicious. They participate in the Coffee Passport program as well. Overall, a beautiful addition to the Pittsburgh Coffee Scene.

VE_pVC7ldI6Z3QEyuQuMhA.text: Formerly 21st Street Coffee, I was anxious to see what the new shop in the strip had to offer. While De Fer makes better use of the space than the prior tenant, the coffee comes at slightly higher price point than before. We ordered the drip coffee and white peony tea, both of which were tasty but nothing to write home about. Extra points for the friendly & knowledge staff, as well as the little chocolates they give with each drink order. I'd certainly come back to explore the very reasonable priced food and alcoholic drink menu, which sets them apart from the other coffee shops in the city.

YUjF7m6zGZ94Qs74TT7vuA.text: Great place to have coffee or boba tea.  It is in and out and it is an old garage. Nice decor and good place for studying. I usually bike here so I am not sure about  good car parking. Definitely has good bike parking.  The stuff is friendly and the food I have not tried yet.

6C8AjN23zwo0_71boqO_8w.text: Love this place! Huge upgrade on the previous coffee place that was in this space.  There is a fair amount of seating (main floor, upstairs balcony, and three sidewalk tables) and the overall coffee-shop design is a clean and simple industrial look. Love little touches like the milky pastel colors for the chairs and coffee cups, lots of natural light, interesting art, etc. Staff is EXTREMELY kind, attentive, and engaging, especially if it's not super busy. Quiet during the day, even if the garage door is up and street noise intrudes.   Coffee drinks are good. Definitely not as fussy as some places, and there are some interesting sweeter options (cortado with maple syrup and their affogato, for instance). They have a limited menu (some breakfast items, panini, meat/cheese plates, and toast), but also have periodic burger nights. They also usually have some interesting pastry options in the case. Definitely highly recommend the yeasted buckwheat waffle with fresh fruit, whipped cream, and a drizzle of maple syrup. Unexpectedly light, slightly crispy, and not at all too sweet. They also have a cocktail menu, wine, and beer, which I haven't fully explored, but the Tango Nuevo cocktail is of particular note for how awesome it is.   Small kitchen/play area for kids, which I think is a really nice touch and helps to welcome a different set of customers into the space.  They have live music nights periodically. These definitely get noisy and the staff encourage the customers to pay attention to the acts/do less chatting...so if you're headed to De Fer on a live music night, it's probably not going to be the best time for an intimate conversation with the person across the table. But they're great and feature a pretty wide mix of styles/performers with a vague thematic element to curate the overall event.  For laptop folks--the outlet situation isn't awesome throughout parts of the space, so that's something to be aware of if you're planning to camp.   Overall, I find it a very welcoming, bright, and thoughtfully managed place!

D0h3UgVVM5d4tRrqmOBtDw.text: Went here for coffee and a small breakfast for my birthday, and we will be back! The staff were so friendly and my latte was amazing! The food was very flavorful, we got a pink tarte, basically a large macaron with fresh raspberries and a breakfast panini, i wish we had gotten more! The coffee was so flavorful!  The chocolate for my latte was really good! The staff were so knowledgeable about coffee and seemed very passionate. They even had a small kid play area which was so nice!

photos.caption: Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

IQkKFfDFrSx2HwpAVpSkgw.text: The music is too loud and people start yelling at each other. Great place but not for working more for socializing.

iWfQ6fMfqZrUHSDARXP34g.text: Another hidden gem of Pittsburgh takes its place! My daughter and I stopped in and were extremely impressed with the beautifully designed and airy cafe. We started with coffee which was great and then decided to stay for lunch. We had creative and exceptional food accompanied by excellent wine. I talked to Sidney and Chris who gave me the rundown on the recent transition. They were both bright and personal. I asked to talk to the cook to compliment her efforts. Her name was Liz and was a delight as she explained how she approached preparing our meals. I think we have found our new favorite cafe.

hE5kfxvvYUkU1-XjOLIG5g.text: De Fer took the place of 21st Street coffee, and has become one of the best coffee shops in town.   Top notch preparation of espresso drinks, and the daily roasts and pour overs are tremendous.   Gone is the coffee arrogance of the former owners, in its place is friendly staff that will guide you to the best beans for your cup, and won't look askance if you want to dump a quart of cream in your coffee.  (Don't do that, but you get the idea.)  There is a small menu, and while food is not the focus of the place, the paninis, pastries and the like are wonderful.   If you're in the Strip District, stop by.  If you're not, then go there anyway.

33oz0fRYIYgo9sJ351jn8A.text: amazing coffees (they make their own simple syrups) and their breakfast sandwiches are really good! parking is kinda screwy but that's the strip district for yinz

UmR6A3iuBKBR3UIJCUnItw.text: Absolutely love this place. The staff are always super friendly and helpful, and they have a great selection of beverages that taste fantastic (seriously, I haven't had one I didn't like, and I've had like 20 different ones.) They also have a myriad of events throughout each month--everything from guest chefs cooking burgers to live music. The atmosphere is usually pretty quiet, and a great place to meet up with a friend for conversation. My favorite drink here is an iced P.A. Cubano, which is sweetened with Pennsylvania maple syrup, but I am also a big fan of their teas, of which they have a huge variety. As far as food, I'd say the best of their sandwiches is the prosciutto one, and their waffles with berries absolutely hit the spot every time. The chai-baked oatmeal is also a great snack. Bottom is if you're looking for a place to hang with someone in the Strip District, sip tasty drinks, and maybe have a snack, this is the place.

l5hvxYonG33i8_LaYtUpZQ.text: Great atmosphere, friendly staff, and great drinks. I decided on a matcha latte with almond milk this morning and it was so smooth and satisfying. The baristas really know what they are doing here. My friend got a nitro cold brew and loved it as well. They also have free "babyccinos" for kids. Cannot wait to come back and try their food items, as the waffles looked amazing.

x-Xrux1Uelpz4hx4cDOzFg.text: Great coffee - roasted in house. Welcoming staff, whom made the experience enjoyable.

J3TQhEMIzY_yrVEpzt_h5Q.text: Cool airy and industrial vibe. Lovely teas. Sidewalk tables, great seating for working/studying. Friendly baristas. Everything you need for a great cafe.

jhdcfGgQyheyzLGsTk3ZTA.text: One of my favorite places on the strip. Staff is kind and courteous and the coffee and food are great.  The "feel" is relaxing and the decor is great.  I have had several different coffees and they all have been great.  Breakfast always hits the spot and the prices are very reasonable.

j84xdrd7mir65b2OZX9mMg.text: The best flat white ever! A cool atmosphere excellent goodies and a nice selection of coffees and teas! Clean great music and very y knowledgeable workers! Can't wait to go back! The other coffees we great too and they have a chai tea that they mix themselves!

XLhCUl49LEXrVYgiyN_Wwg.text: Had to check out this new coffee place in the old 21st coffee space. Totally impressed and we come to the Strip every weekend. Good latte, amazing coffee waffle with berries. Bought tea and maple syrup to go home. We will be back!!

LIsrhHi4FYx4my3VABE-Lg.text: Amazing breakfast panini, and great coffee and tea.  Glad I found this place, which is tucked away from from the long brunch lines.  Highly recommend.

OuDA-gEF3pnRCYvArp3aZQ.text: Great find for our weekend getaway in Pittsburgh! Excellent coffee, tea, and breakfast food options. The breakfast panini was delicious! Open and airy atmosphere. Would highly recommend!

AmiFlr0s1DFI32kb-Rmgnw.text: Great coffee, lots of cool locally roasted flavors with ample seating to enjoy a treat before you grab a bag to take home.

ziOkIqOluc5DovSj5pnoEg.text: This is such a great cafe! Whenever we visit New Orleans, we go to this cafe called EnVie, and every time I wish we had something similar in Pittsburgh: A relaxed space where you can get coffee OR alcohol, or both in an Irish coffee! Well, I can happily say De Fer is that place. You can sit with a coffee and work on your laptop, or enjoy some day drinking and brunching on a day off.   The coffee itself is wonderful. My husband is extremely particular about his espresso, and De Fer is now one of the few coffee shops he knows he can reliably get an espresso that's to his liking. I am much less particular, but enjoyed both drip coffee, and the maple-sweetened PA Cubano.   I haven't tried any of the alcohol offerings yet, but my dad is a Negroni fan, and said theirs was excellent. De Fer offers beer (including Iron City for when you need a budget option), wine, and some awesome sounding cocktails featuring mostly local spirits. They have an entire list of bottle-rested negronis, which I am excited to try.  Food options look great, featuring pastries from the to-die-for La Gourmandine. I will certainly update when I try the food here.  I really love that they have children's books to read with your little ones; it's a nice touch that made me feel especially welcome with my baby.

iVdFokg_preYFvC2wnvz_g.text: Went to the opening and this seems like it'll be a great addition to the strip! I got a strawberry jam and waffle  love the concept! I love the decor and they have  retail from Strip favorite shops which is a nice convenience! I mean how can you go wrong with everyone favorite drinks - coffee and booze?

KqYni6EbllpxcjnDwOzDLA.text: We found this coffee shop by purchasing the Pittsburgh coffee password. Very unique menu and we chose in espresso with ice cream on top! Located in the strip definitely recommend it

photos.caption: Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

nE7ujs9QoCoM9jXivk-VRg.text: The barista was FRIENDLY AND OUTGOING!! A first that I have seen. The typical staff I run into at local coffee shops treat you like you interrupted their instagram post. The cortado was amazing and so was the london fog. Atmosphere was lovely. We will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

dPTr6KbvtU7ip5RWlO4_iQ.text: Probably my new favorite coffee house, if you can call it that. Wonderful service, atmosphere, music and prices are not higher than Starbucks. Besides coffee they have an assortment of interesting teas, cocktails, wines, and brunch foods(including waffles!). Good location with lots of parking nearby. I believe they replaced 21 street espresso, and if you loved them you'll love this place even more

photos.caption: Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

GjiszMaiGCRpaYPpPccp3A.text: Really nice ambience, great service, and even better coffee. I had the cortado and went back and tried two more of their numerous coffees. The hummus was good as well. I'll be returning.

9Q8B_eo1cl_A0csgaETKTA.text: Stumbled into this adorable and well-decorated cafe and fell in love. I didn't order food but I will definitely be back because it all looked amazing! I ordered a medium roast coffee to go and added a small amount of cream and it was the best cup of coffee that I've had in a while. I highly recommend this spot-- would be perfect for a cute date, a business meeting, or getting some work done. There's a more secluded loft area, as well.

1B0ZG9AEcky8O94kNUzfYQ.text: A great cafe in the heart of the Strip.  I don't drink coffee but the tea selection is fantastic.  The food menu is limited but tasty, and the staff is knowledgeable and friendly.  They also have a cool assortment of locally made food items ranging from maple syrup to pasta to pickles.  The space is large yet still cozy and inviting.  Seating was somewhat limited when we went on a busy Sunday afternoon.  They now roast their coffee on the atrium overlooking the shop so you have a great view of the process.

cBxaEcyyacM7JIgOTgYGLw.text: Excellent quiche for breakfast and the coffee was fast to go and superb! Great customer service and returned same day with colleagues for afternoon tea. Delighted to return.

Cb2fbAYjsjq59OAs_hDIfg.text: Awesome spot in the strip district.  Good coffee, friendly employees, and great ambiance.

yZQb_OGkw_4n26lTGP88jA.text: A good, new, independent 3rd Wave Coffee joint with a bunch of enthusiastic folks behind the counter in the former 21st Street Coffee location.   The specialty drinks lean towards the sweet. There's a cortado on the menu, but it's suburban, with maple sugar and whipped cream. The menu will be expanded to include food. Big blank slate boards on the wall suggest they're planning ahead.  Exceptionally spacious, the location seems to encourage lingering. The chairs and tables aren't quite cozy but, it'll no doubt be a fine coffice for more than a few freelancers. Roasting equipment may move in upstairs, I hear. De Fer will not only be blending and roasting beans, but teas. Indie tea blenders are too rare these days.   On a slow second-to-opening day, I was offered a taste two distinct espressos, ordered a cortado with one, bought a bag of beans of the other. The bag's blend, Sons of Vulcan, is a reference to steel workers, but also Star Trek, in my mind. It lent itself well to tiramisu.

HoXo1cEMlCrZApIthNVnbw.text: Love the decor, service, and fun mix of coffee/tea and cocktails. Great on a gorgeous spring day :)

2hXGhnhr5s8_5QS6_g4kxw.text: Just became a new Yinzer and needed to find a coffee place stat that meets my standards - great service, excellent drinks, and a place to work. Luckily that hidden gem is right here in the Strip District. I hate to share this place since I know more people will end up here, but it's too good not to share with locals and tourists alike! My fiance and I ordered the Affogato (with lemon ice cream...sounds crazy but the flavors complement each other) and the PA Cubano. Best cubano I've had since Colada in Fort Lauderdale, Florida - iced coffee that's a little bit sweet. Can't wait to visit these guys again soon to get my new Yinz fix - the PA Cubano.

HCX2rvZ_4mMBNPIM43gljw.text: We walked here from our hotel for a "real" cup of coffee.  My husband had a cup of coffee with a shot of espresso and I had a maple bourbon latte.  After tasting his I wished I had gotten what he got!  Whatever brew he got had almost a slight sour taste but a deliciously nutty aftertaste.  It was really unique and enjoyable.  My latte was very good as well but not as interesting as his coffee's flavor.  The space was large but not very cozy.  Very nice spot however and worth the walk!

vi94fqT0yl2sBpGDP78CMQ.text: Great place to hang out and work. I love that they have coffee and cocktails available! :)

6q0SpdE0FoUsm2e5AHLqCw.text: It is refreshing to speak to baristas who know their roasts--which is an easy thing at De Fer since the baristas are also the roasters. While visiting the area, we went here twice and each time I was excellently guided to make a correct choice in beans, espresso and even non-dairy milk to complement the flavors. It was all perfect. Very comfortable table areas with good lighting. I purchased some beans to enjoy in our home and their subtle nuances continue to seep through. It is always refreshing to find such a great coffee shop that emphasizes excellence, knowledge, real mugs (not just paper cups) and willingly shares that with us. I enjoyed browsing their shelves with local products. My husband is not a coffee drinker but he did indulge in a flaky pastry that was fresh and flavorful.

yjpALZHCCvGkkmiIvw8plw.text: My friend and I were wandering around on a very chilly day. To warm up, we stopped in the nearest coffee place we could find - De Fer! Unbeknownst to us, this place just opened last week or so, but it was still a nice spot. Plenty of seating, clean, updated, and friendly staff. My friend got a cortado and I got a chai tea latte. Both were good. If you're in the area, definitely stop in!

photos.caption: Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

NtTiMw6JeNwxS7ftaNqW3g.text: A beautiful space, friendly service, but my drink was of extremely poor quality. I ordered a cortado, which is something that you can find beautifully prepared at almost every well-known craft coffee shop in this city (which there a number of) and I was very disappointed to find the milk steamed quite poorly. I won't pretend to be able to taste espresso clearly through milk, but even that seemed to be rather sour. Additionally, I found it odd that the cortado was not served in a clear glass (something which you traditionally find in most shops) but this is just a matter of personal preference. I think they need to spend some time on barista training.    I will reiterate that the staff was extremely kind and attentive.   My point is this: it is no secret that this place poached this former location of the excellent (although historically notorious for customer service) 21st Street Coffee and Tea. Nevermind my fondness for the former business, I would remain wary of an establishment that selectively engages with a community, but runs out other local businesses for its own benefit, and then can't quite deliver on the goods.

gaJrOIjkQpslYR_BoAjVcQ.text: I used to make 21st Street Coffee my go to Sunday morning spot. The baristas were passionate and knowledgeable about coffee and took their time to make sure the drink was perfect before it would hit the counter. De Fer has the right idea with the menu and decor but needs barista training. Shots are pulled incorrectly  (they have a scale and timers but not used) and drinks (particularly the mocha) needs a lot of work. Way too sweet, almost undrinkable, and the the milk wasn't even steamed correctly. (No micro foam, very Starbucks like mix mash of some milk and espresso). There's a lot of competition in Pittsburgh. Great coffee shops, talented baristas, and coffee consumers that raise the bar in quality and expectation. De Fer needs to get off on the right foot by surrounding themselves with passionate people. Especially in such an iconic location.

xquQau7qIm_dWczXiv7N-g.text: Probably my favorite coffee shop in Pittsburgh! Excellent espresso drinks, oat milk (a personal favorite), great food (I got the grilled haloumi sandwich), beer and cocktails! There's lots of seating and free WiFi to get some studying done, but there also seemed to be a ton of people just enjoying a meal or some family time. It's tucked out of sight near Cavo on Smallman St, so finding parking is the trickiest part. But once you find it it's well worth it!

n6uot1s0FPLvE3ca8fgm3w.text: Alcohol, Coffee and Kombucha on tap, all in one place!   I came here a couple weeks ago to meet my boss. I've always been a frequent visitor of the strip but I had no idea about De Fer. I was unsure what to try so I asked the barista what they recommended. I ended up getting a strawberry spritzer (I cant remember the exact name but it was awesome.)   I was so impressed with my first visit I brought my girlfriend here about a week later. We both got the same drink I tried my first visit. She wasn't as much of a fan as I was but she still enjoyed it. We also tried a dessert and it didn't disappoint! After our dessert we asked the barista if we could try the different kombuchas on tap. We tried two different kinds and each sample was huge!   **FYI** be sure to bring your ID here if you're into getting kombucha. The alcohol content is high so they have to card you if you want to have some/try it.   Everything I've tried so far has been delicious. This is a must go to place when you're in the strip!   The service and staff here are really welcoming and helpful for first time visitors. The vibes here are awesome, if it's warm enough they open the garage door on the front and there is a loft!

lpQpFvWFCEuRUAQr1OWWQg.text: Good, not great.  It's a mix of 5-star and 2-star...  Okay, I love coffee, and consider myself knowledgeable on the topic of coffee and coffee houses.  Here's my breakdown of this place:  FACILITY - It's beautiful and clean.  Narrow and very deep, I love the old, exposed brick walls and wooden floors.  It feels like what it is - an old, re-purposed space in the Strip District.  So 5-stars for the space and environment.  COFFEE DRINKS - Quite good.  Espresso is smooth with good, golden foam on top, and just enough "bite" at the end of each sip.  I like La Prima (also in the strip) better, though...  And, wow, their drinks are expensive (relative to great, nearby competitors).  COFFEE BEANS - I make espresso and other coffee drinks at home, so of course, I grind my own beans.  They roast their own beans here, but are a bit proud of them:  $20+ per pound is almost double what GREAT competitors charge (e.g., Allegheny Coffee & Tea exchange, one block away; Prestogeorge's, also one block away; Nicholas Coffee in Market Square).  So overall, I'm let down by the unobtainable bean pricing, and a bit by the coffee drinks pricing.  I'm no cheapskate, but this place just feels badly to me, and the notion of ridiculously priced beans in Pittsburgh, in the Strip District, like it's tourist-bait, just doesn't sit well with me...

G5GV-Wr3dkrzL76BtY51oQ.text: I attended De Fer for the first time due to an elite yelp event. They offered a platter of food, various drinks, and a bean roasting demonstration. I was very impressed with everything I saw from the decor to the authenticity of the coffee making process. With De Fer, you could drink coffee, have an adult beverage with friends, choose from a variety of foods from breakfast to desert, or even go shopping for some kitchen essentials. In simple, this shop offers it all, and I will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

oZTiWKGH3AFWiVMZx8y2BA.text: I loved the set up of the shop as well as my time there. The staff was very passionate and knowledgeable about what they were doing. You could tell that they had done their research on certain aspects of coffee and also liked to experiment. It was neat to see a coffee shop with great coffee and food as well as alcohol! I would definitely recommend coming here for a myriad of activities. I think it would also be a great location if you're looking to get some work or studying done. I could see myself coming here for a day and starting with coffee then transitioning to a cocktail as the day goes on!

photos.caption: Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

NAkbrIqaMKUFImcKZWD4HA.text: This is my sister's ( a Pitt resident) favorite coffee shop; it did not disappoint! I loved the brink interior with cascading sunlight through the large from windows. The cafe tables and Tiffany blue chairs promoted a subtle chic vibe with an air of carefree whimsy. The murals and local artist's work on the walls add a bit of color and flavor to the environment, but overall the cafe offers a sanctuary from the hustle and bustle of the outside world. The crowd was a mix of studying students, working professionals and a few friendly hangouts. A quick review of the menu will delight your taste buds; the carefully crafted coffee, cafe sandwiches, and teas will satisfy even the most selective consumers. We tried the caprese baguette and the Lonzetta panini; both were scrumptious! I was also very pleased with their ice coffee. I drank it black and it wasn't too bitter for me. My sister got a the Strawberry Jam-tea was substituted for the alcohol listed in the menu. It was recommended by the barista and while my sister liked it, she commented that it wouldn't be added to her cafe favorites.   Overall, we had a lovely experience at De Fur! I will be sure to venture back here on my next visit to Pittsburgh.

photos.caption: Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Delicious lonzetta panini! The mustard and pickles def took this sandwich to the next level.

fyLi7HGcGWJU8SmpyzzcQA.text: So sad that I discovered this place so late in the game! My friend and I came here to get some work done and the productivity level was so high. The atmosphere is calming. Lots of natural floods the two-story shop. The menu selection has a nice variety and is rather affordable. We sat upstairs and absolutely loved it! We both had the grilled cheese which was excellent. I tried the maple cortado, and it was lovely. Then I purchased a carafe (20oz) of coffee for only $5! My only regret is that I wish I would've found this shop sooner.

photos.caption: Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Beautiful Brick Art
Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Just more goodies!
Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Goodies for sale!

jiNxjfdMox_ir1aBx0eKng.text: While I was here for a Yelp Event a few months ago I visited again recently to get my coffee passport stamped and I think it's my new favorite coffee shop. I took my husband who is a coffee enthusiast and he was also impressed with menu and enjoyed his drip coffee. I went a little fancier with a mint mocha that was beautiful and tasty. This was also my first time ordering food and I cannot recommend the breakfast panini enough- a top notch breakfast sandwich, perfectly pressed, just like the coffee. My husband tried the espresso and cream waffles and loved them as well- will have to try recreating this one at home (the homemade whipped cream had me sneaking more bites). It is a bigger coffee shop with additional seating upstairs and extremely friendly owners.

jhk7fiipWzlRGCVdPtZD6w.text: One of my new favorite cafes in Pittsburgh! I love the bright and relaxing atmosphere. There's plenty of tables and, most importantly, free WiFi so I can catch up on some work while pumping myself with caffeine. I would recommend their lavender grey latte which is amazing! They don't have sugar free syrups, but they do have almond and oat milk for you vegan peeps. Prices are a little higher than average. A small latte was $4.50, but since I'm hanging out stealing WiFi and table space, I can't really complain. Definitely a place everyone should check out!

photos.caption: Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lavender Grey Iced Latte $4.50

bqGYzk87BDkTPjQ8iZ-t5g.text: De Fer Coffee had very great customer service. Despite the cold weather and it being late in the day, the barista behind the counter was very cheerful and helpful. I had the fall harvest latte. It wasn't so sweet, but had a a great spice-y flavor to it. The atmosphere was really nice too, the spacious cafe was filled with local art that was for sale.

i_ZekOer8qv8UOAkLfInDg.text: A friend of mine recommended this place and it was the best find! Their mason jar cold brews are seriously the most amazing. The staff is always the absolute sweetest! They have a great spot, it's very chill and it's fun to grab a coffee (they also have cocktails!) highly recommend!

vaYvo0sFCG0BKlMk4SwY6Q.text: I was pleasantly surprised by this cafe! First of all, there are lots of seats so it's a great place to have a chat with friends or do work. The wifi is also very reliable!  The pastries were amazing - I'm a huge fan of almond croissants and I can say that the almond croissant I had here was one of the best I've ever eaten. The service was great as well. The table my friend and I were sitting at was very wobbly, and the workers came right away and fixed the table for us.  The coffee is kind of expensive - an iced latte is 4.25 for only 10 oz, but the quality is good and they have lots flavors.  Overall, I had a great experience here and I'll be coming back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Almond Croissant + Iced Latte - so good!

fAtJsahhj3Kkc40iLKfAcw.text: Love this new coffee/ tea spot in the Strip! Located on Smallman, it's nice that it's a bit behind the chaos that is Penn Ave. I came here two weeks ago, around 3:45pm, without knowing that they close at 4:00pm. I ordered oolong tea, admired the art on the walls, and got comfy. I checked in on yelp and freaked out a little when I saw that they were closing in a few minutes. Vanessa, who owns the shop with her husband, was working and was SO incredibly kind when I asked her if I needed to leave, since they were closing. Since some other customers were in the shop talking and hanging out, Vanessa said it was fine for me to stay too, as it takes a while to break down all of the machines and clean them. How sweet is that? I was able to sip my delicious tea for 45 minutes and work on some school work and enjoy the calming ambiance of this gorgeous shop. I really appreciated that.  Not only is this a coffee/tea shop, but it's a little market! They have tons of local items like honey, bread, oils & vinegars, jams, salt, baked goods, and everything you would need to brew the perfect cup of tea or coffee at home. Not only that, but De Fer is planning on having cocktails and wine in the next upcoming months as well! Once that happens, the hours will be extended. What an awesome concept.   Truly a beautiful coffee shop, in a great location, with fantastic owners. Can't wait to come back.

F1td8HUMghOOLWtm-3foOg.text: A great place to study! The drinks come out quick and there are a few outlets but the tables can be sparse if it's a busy day. The Gorgonzola and prosciutto panini is absolutely amazing and will melt in your mouth with each bite!

HFi4ujgajOwheRGQ764ijA.text: Honestly, the best coffee shop in Pittsburgh right now, and what a difference from its predecessor 21st Coffee and their horrible customer service and awful ownership. Its rare to find a beautiful space, friendly staff/amazing customer service, delicious coffee and food, and an actual variety of options. Most of the places in the city  have fallen victim to offering only sweet pastries, The paninis here are top notch, I've never had a bad cup of coffee -- and how many places in PGH can you transition into a cocktail or local kombucha if you've been working all morning and can't handle anymore caffeine?   De Fer knows what the city needed, and they are doing it right! It's a shame of the construction outside at the moment that limits parking or a quick stop in for a coffee on-the-go, but trust me, its worth the walk around the block if you can't park right outside the door. I recommend De Fer to everyone I know, and have sworn off all my other usual spots in order spend my money at a place that deserves it. A+++++++

s_8WtlPbAk448HlfGXgqGA.text: Quite a few savory food items such as paninis, waffles, sandwiches along with coffee drinks. Pleasantly surprised to see alcoholic drinks.

Db3gyEvO7oOJbOHlYkvfYA.text: This is an amazing cafe in the heart of the Strip District. It was so nice, especially after the chaos of all of the construction to be able to visit a cafe that was completely handicap accessible, and so easy to get into and out of.  I was very impressed and will come back when we are back in town. Thank you so much!

U5Mvgp44TBtzk-Q_ncabcQ.text: What a neat space in the Strip! They sell local products and art, they have fun events like trivia night, burgher Friday, and they have live music.   I tried their medium roast and the prosciutto panini for a quick lunch. The coffee was excellent, and you get a free refill. The panini was simple and delicious. I can't wait to come back to try some of their adult beverages and cheeses and to check out some of their fun events!

HOllOuBJnAXvjh9xa_hGng.text: This place has great ambiance, friendly staff and delicious wares. I ducked into here by accident while waiting for my table at a nearby restaurant and was so happy I did! If I'm ever back in this area I'll make it a point to swing by and grab another delicious dose of caffeine.

drJae-UFm3NmELiIMmMgsA.text: The staff at De Fer is wonderful and each of them seem so passionate about De Fer and what it has to offer.   Although the coffee is fresh - they roast it right in house - and tastes great De Fer is so much more than a coffee shop. Beyond the fact that they offer wine, beer and cocktails, it is a wonderful space to be.   I could seriously imagine myself visiting De Fer in the future for a coffee date with my boyfriend, to catch up with old friends or to spend a few hours to catch up on work or even (I'm thinking a few months ahead) set up shop and write my Christmas cards!

bMlaRrS43MRug8tF12k5kA.text: I finally was able to make it back here after attending their Yelp event last year. It was just as good as I remember it! My wife and I came with another couple after going to Orchard Hill Church in the strip district.   I ordered an 8 oz light roast coffee and we split the breakfast sandwich and the cranberry ginger smoothie. Everything here tastes so fresh, and for $7 it's hard to beat such a delicious breakfast sandwich. The pesto cream cheese was noticeable in it and my mouth kept coming back for more.  Loved going here for breakfast! It's a great little coffee place with very high quality food and at an affordable price.

FluR7678Dke29XG21UlUNA.text: I came here for a Yelp Elite event and was very impressed! I think the best part were the owners/staff. I've never met anyone so passionate about coffee. They really put a lot of effort into making sure each bean is perfectly roasted and each cup is perfectly brewed. I honestly didn't love the coffee samples that we tried (too acidic for me), but the staff were very clear in telling us that they were serving an acidic coffee, and I'm confident they could recommend a different variety next time I visit  I also love that they served salted chocolate chip cookies, which have recently become my favorite kind. Their food menu looks amazing, and I can't wait to come back and try other dishes  Another highlight is their wall of products, mostly from local Pittsburgh vendors. They had things like flavored honey and beer "jam", as well as a great selection of tea leaves  Friendly people, good food, good drinks (coffee and cocktails?!), well-decorated space, what's not to love?

photos.caption: Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Wall of products from local vendors

WyAJwbvBRrijBQpta6hRDQ.text: Here's a creative local business that attracts great people. It's practically the perfect concept, taking you from breakfast in the morning to a filling lunch to drinks in the evening. Most recently I enjoyed a warm oatmeal bar with honey and Greek yogurt, plus a fruit smoothie. Next time I want to try the quiche and maybe a baked good. The paninis and negronis aren't to be missed either. So many choices! Which is why you just have to keep coming back. Parking isn't all that bad, to be honest, but you might have to angle for a seat along the brick wall where the outlets are, if you're planning to stay a while to work on your laptop.

photos.caption: Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Strata and mango ginger shake
Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Baked oatmeal bar with fruit smoothie

yVE79p9hjGrb6yIbBGS_9w.text: The barista was very helpful, friendly, and knowledgeable. However the owner or manager seemed really curt and irritated to answer questions. They have a very limited tea selection and only one herbal tea which frankly was kind of gross. Asking about tea clearly marked me as "not a coffee" person, and that seemed to be the genesis of the attitude from the owner/manager.   Lots of potential here, but the menu needs a bit of work.

owPs2LfyQkZ3RbKnzlOexg.text: What a fun coffee shop! If I were a writer, I'd come here to write my first hit novel. We stopped in this shop for a cup of coffee on a cold and damp Pittsburgh day. If you need a gift, they sell adorable local Pittsburgh groceries and goods too. Don't miss this spot for a good coffee or latte!

photos.caption: Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Gluten free goods!

J6nbWDNfueH7aDBoiF027Q.text: This was my second visit and I had great experiences both times.  I ordered the latte and a gluten-free donut.  The staff delivers your order to your seat, it has a nice sized seating area.  The staff was kind and helpful when using my Coffee Passport for the second visit.  We go to Orchard Hill Church which is right up the street and this may be our new coffee stop before church!

photos.caption: Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Latte and GF donut
Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Maple Cortado

Vzwl4MMBkred8YK1tZAryA.text: 5 star space, 5 star coffee, 5 star people. Love coming here to work, hangout, or just to grab a yummy treat. Definitely stop if you haven't been here before - stay and hang if you're able to (great playlists too)!

photos.caption: Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

GpaFu2NXwIaIlVLAdUObcQ.text: Stoped for a cappuccino to go while walking around the strip district on a cold night.   Not only was the drink great but the service was wonderful! The barista was incredibly friendly and warm. She made my day!   I will definitely be back to explore more of their menu!

nhl29QWjFxouzbVv0PcFMw.text: An excellent coffee shop with a few lunch items and pastries. Lots of space,  lots of outlets around for gear ot gadget charging.   I like getting a cafe mocha now and then, and I love the way they make it here!

Cfipvq7yIYcA2IJZR1GYcw.text: My first visit to De Fer was courtesy of Yelp and I can't tell you how blown away I was by this store. The staff are so knowledgeable about coffee, tea, wine, beer, everything! They were very welcoming and happily answered all of my questions about how coffee is made, they even let us see some coffee beans that weren't roasted yet... it was so cool!  I am not a huge coffee drinker so I sampled their lavender tea and I have to say, that was one of the most refreshing iced teas I have ever had. I also tried some of their cheese selection and as a cheese lover I was really impressed.  The atmosphere is very welcoming and I could see myself taking my laptop there to get some work done.  Parking was tough due to construction but don't let it keep you away! De Fer is worth walking a few blocks!

DD57Nk3P7GSfKRNXJu62fA.text: Wow, what a great coffee shop located in the Strip District! Parking is a bit limited right now with all the construction. The coffee shop has a very cozy feeling and plenty of seating. I had a lavender latte and it was delicious! The lavender was very subtle and the espresso was quality. There are two levels of seating, so my friends and I went upstairs to do our work. We were there for several hours studying. After a while, a barista came by and gave us a vegan peppermint latte she had some extra of. It was such a thoughtful gesture as she could tell we were getting tired and very much appreciated. I will definitely be back! Thank you to the staff for making a Saturday full of studying more bearable! Overall, a wonderful coffee shop to grab a bite to eat as they have a nice menu or to do work!

photos.caption: Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lavender latte!
Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lavender latte with chai in back

3KwxR6tjFQNB0Ur4gvxRHA.text: Very cool coffee & cocktail spot in the Strip right next to Kaya.  I attended an event here tonight, which was great, because I never would have known this little shop was even here otherwise.  They have a great menu of coffee, food, alcoholic beverages, and also lots of local artisan products for sale.  I tried the food, some drinks, the coffee, and everything was incredibly wonderful.  I look forward to visiting again . . . Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

BdKknekhTlnrLWCQ72yw3Q.text: This is such a cute, aesthetically pleasing space with good coffee and food. I've tried their signature nitro cold brew, which has strong, bold flavors, and their regular iced coffee, which is also good. Their apple & brie panini was perfectly pressed with the outside nice and crispy and the inside warm and cheesy. The brie paired perfectly with the apple and the honey dijon. If you're looking for a place to grab a bite to eat with coffee while doing work, I highly recommend De Fer!

photos.caption: Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Apple + Brie Panini and Iced Coffee

1LC43lbEdppCNpmB3H7q2w.text: I was here Saturday morning as my parents arrived from Chicago to visit for the first time.  So, we ventured to the strip on this absolutely gorgeous morning.  This is one of my favorite coffee stops and this visit was absolutely wonderful.  I am a creature of habit and ordered my go to drink, iced latte and it was great as usual.  I love the space and it was not crowded when we arrived so we sat and enjoyed our coffee and conversation.  By the time we left, it was packed.  You can not beat a good coffee, great atmosphere, and even better, the sun(the sun is a commodity here).

J8wve8DhSafVlh5KzhSr2w.text: Let's be honest, had it not been for the amazing Yelp Elite event last evening I probably would not have ever stopped in here but I am SO glad I did. I don't live in the city so this wouldn't be a daily stop to or from work, BUT, now that I've been I will definitely not be a stranger. In fact I plan on coming tomorrow for their seasonal peach waffles :)  Being a coffee drinker I completely appreciated the roasting tour as well the intro to the Chemex system in brewing coffee. Their selection of coffee is fantastic and they roast in House some of the finest beans available.  Not only is this a coffee house but they also serve a small but great selection of beers including brew on tap from a local brewery, which I do love a good beer, especially local. Why stop at beer when you can have wine and other select cocktails. This place delivers. Their baked goods and sandwich selection is impressive so don't feel this is just your simple Coffee joint. They have trivia night and are proud to display local artwork which gives this establishment that small city feel and makes you welcome like family. Kudos to Matt and his wife (I believe that's the owners name)  and the entire De Fer team. I don't rate 5 stars often but you delivered on all cylinders.

photos.caption: Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Awesome Yelp Elite evening

4OtOLZkHoX18KIYH7F3_QA.text: I just want to start off by saying I absolutely LOVE this coffee shop!   I came here for an elite event and I was very impressed by the space, the staff, and the coffee. You can tell the staff and the owners have poured everything into this shop and they truly put love into each cup of coffee, from choosing the beans to the roasting process, until it's brewed and ready to drink. Also, they have food and alcohol which makes it the perfect space for just about anything, from breakfast to lunch, to an after work drink, it seems like it could fit just about any occasion.   It's a very open space and seems like it could be a good space for studying but it also seems like a space for meeting up with people, so it may get a bit noisy at times. I'm very excited to come back and try more of their food and drink menu.

lzeDwFvbk34ZrBsbrDXflQ.text: Last time I went to this location, it was literally an entirely different cafe with a different look, feel, service, foods and beverages. I can honestly say that De Fer is an upgrade to what once was.  The interior design is open and inviting, with brick walls contrasted with brightly colored art and seating. There are flowers at each table and even a playroom for kids.  Not only do they sell espresso drinks, but they also sell baked goods, merch and other goods!  The baristas are very very very friendly, nice and super helpful! They were patient and non-judgmental of all my questions and curiosities. Frankly, this is rare among coffee shop culture.  The coffee was pretty good, though the espresso wasn't as deep or bitter as I personally would have liked but to each their own! The syrup, made on-site, is not too sweet but prominent enough.  Would definitely come here a gain!

photos.caption: Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Vanilla (homemade syrup) Lattes w/ cute little treats
Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bright, colorful and inviting
Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Aesthetic interior

z3NVJPa9uJcolizGdotFUA.text: We were recommended this coffee shop from another coffee shop in the area while we were in town visiting.  The baristas were very nice and explained all their many options.  We got a few drinks which were good.  The atmosphere was very nice and kid friendly which for us is a big deal.  They even gave our kids a babycino, which the kids enjoyed.  Steamed milk with foam and some cocoa powder on top.  So the kids sat there and had their drink with us.  It was also nice because they have a little shelf full of kids books and even let us take one.  They also had a play kitchen that the kids had a good time playing with, with little coffee items.  This was a good find in the Strip district and well worth the stop!

TWDqmcZrWgalMT1sS6pcug.text: What a cute coffee shop! I definitely underestimated this place as I was having trouble finding parking and nearly missed the entrance to the shop--but I'm so glad I didn't!! The baristas were so nice to talk to and I enjoyed a wonderful vanilla latte on a rainy Pittsburgh day. I will definitely be back to sample more of their food options, I was salivating just looking at the menu!!

photos.caption: Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. View from upstairs
Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Vanilla Latte

6Z7HQsONcWmK_LapD719gg.text: What cool little spot. And know this now, De Fer isn't just coffee and tea. They have a nice selection of local beer and cocktails available as well. We stopped in on a Sunday Funday and grabbed a few cocktail. They were both well made with fresh ingredients. The spot has local art on the walls that is also for sale. They also offer food. I will definitely have to go back for lunch and grab something to eat. They also told me that they have live music a few nights per weeks as well. I have a feeling I'll be frequenting this spot a lot more!

photos.caption: Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. French 75 cocktail
Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Apple Cake Cocktail

Kx0jBPGO9Gq4a2CUbHuyUg.text: Really solid matcha latte with oat milk.   Great wares for sale.  Hilarious cards which prompted me to buy a few (I don't buy cards ...ever...but they were so good)!  Spacious and beautiful interior.   Great spot for coffee and tea, even better to work remote!

f54bwSLMhZrIMQr4M3HnvQ.text: The folks working here are really lovely. In a space where volume can be a disorganized environment for people living with anxieties and disabilities the staff here made me feel very comfortable.   The coffee was great, had an almond milk cortado and some BLUME blueberry HONIEEE WATER    IG: @mcgobro

photos.caption: Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. SITTING SPACE
Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. COFFEE BAR

9649voQDNSymb09h2eRHzw.text: Does anyone know the spell from Harry Potter where I can place this coffee shop in my pocket and bring it back to New Orleans? I'm willing to pay in Vanilla Rose Iced Lattes from De Fer because I'm so sad I'm leaving this place with y'all in Pittsburgh.   Let me be selfish and show her how much she'd be loved by locals in New Orleans.  The ambiance is so pretty here and the love for local artists is beyond. I can't get over how beautiful this coffee shop was with all of the exposed brick and open space.   This place impressed me so much that I visited this place twice within a three day trip. I'M OBSESSED.  That Vanilla Rose Iced Latte has forever changed the game and they offer oat milk. She keeps getting better and better. The staff here is so welcoming and I never wanted to leave. The assortment of plants made it feel so warm.  Damn you Rachel C for showing me this place. I'll never be able to get De Fer outta my mind.

photos.caption: Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Iced vanilla rose oat milk latte
Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Menu July 2019
Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Menu July 2019

9OZvjdRrDKkBIYzQXYBv3Q.text: Looking for a quick breakfast after shopping at the strip district before heading to the Steelers game. Found this wonderful place on a side street. Had coffee and split a breakfast sandwich with my buddy. I had the English muffin and it was incredible. Homemade muffing with fresh eggs. My buddy had a panini - also incredible. Looking for a good breakfast while on the strip - don't bother standing in line at one of the other places, come here and enjoy a freshly make artisan sandwich with a great cup of Joe!

photos.caption: Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

wdAD2HWsY-cUxdUVj6IEYw.text: Perfect morning. Just what I was looking for. I've had superb coffee from all over the country and this is right up there with them. But more than that this place had atmosphere that everyone is looking for in a coffee shop too. Calm and relaxed. Great food. (I had the coffee and cream waffle). Knowledgeable staff and great variety in flavors all around.

Da_lGD4zXb0Tt1X6IIARcQ.text: This has been my go-to spot to work the last few weeks. It's spacious, warm and the menu options can get you through the entire day. You'll find plenty of outlets to charge whatever it is you need. Parking is the only hang up, but it's the Strip! You can't help the construction.   I seem to always start my visit here with English Breakfast tea. I usually have it steeped at least three times before my day is up. The staff is happy to refill my cup keeping me warm and happy as I work. If you stay long enough and need lunch, order the Prosciutto Panini. It's packed with flavor and only takes a few minutes to prepared. While you're ordering you'll see the big display of desserts. Save it for your afternoon pick me up...   They also sell a number of locally made goods like honey, cheese, jams and art. Some thing new appears on every visit. Join the email list to hear about the monthly events like wine tastings and yoga.

photos.caption: Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Z_7rdT-2HzwRdJz4aeLwdQ.text: My husband and I attended a Yelp event here and were able to return after attending church in the Strip District on a Sunday morning. I was thoroughly excited to return as they left a remarkable impression during the event.   I love every concept this coffee shop has to offer. They create their own blends of coffee in house, offer a variety of fresh cocktails, wine, local beer and cider, (at a coffee shop?! who knew..), support local small businesses by selling their products, and provide a fresh and seasonal menu with a unique selection.   My husband and I decided to share the Breakfast Panini and a Cranberry Ginger Smoothie. The panini was filled with fresh eggs, cheese, pancetta, and a unique pesto dijon spread served on farmhouse bread. Everything about it screamed "made from scratch!". The smoothie was made from fresh cranberries, banana, orange juice, ginger and greek yogurt - it tasted as fresh as if I made it in my kitchen, with perfect consistency and beautiful color.   Not only does this shop offer sandwiches and smoothies, but they have quite a selection that will satisfy anyone: waffles, fresh breads/toast, meat and cheese platters, cereals, along with a display case full of baked items and salads. Their prices were very reasonable, especially for the quality that they served.   Finally, the staff. The owners remain actively involved from a consumer standpoint by waiting on customers and engaging in conversation. The rest of the staff are just as pleasant and eager to serve.   I would love to make this a regular stop when we head to the Strip for church, for shopping, or when biking downtown. This place is hard to beat!

photos.caption: Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Breakfast Panini and Cranberry Ginger Smoothie

_xy2O_RcDzRSioudbK0hJQ.text: Great food and coffee plus kombucha on draft! It's a great place for brunch or to work on your laptop!

YmIO0DtH4PTyAZIRtLRU2g.text: This beautiful coffee shop was the perfect place to put in a few hours of work during my last Pittsburgh trip. The staff were all so friendly! I felt like a regular even though it was my first time there.   I ordered the vegetable quiche for breakfast and an americano. The quiche was very nice; it was surprisingly moist and had great flavor. My americano was great.   My friend ordered the vanilla rooibus tea which smelled absolutely heavenly! I'd love to visit this shop again the next time I'm in town.

photos.caption: Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Vegetable quiche and Americano

owlrQjlGeKFxqIaKmcW9Qg.text: The place that took over where 21st street coffee had been. I'm tempted to downgrade them a star because I had a lot of trouble with their internet. But the quality of food and drink are both high, prices are reasonable, it is not too hipsterish, and there is the right balance of seats to space. Definitely a coffee shop I'd recommend checking out.

ur-VyW9zldYuCdGTQxYUqQ.text: I give this place props for becoming my "third place." Mainly because they have the perfect combo for me, killer space, great selection of tea and THEN fantastic cocktails! I have honestly been waiting for a spot like this to open where I could work by day or night and/or meet up in a chill space for a cocktail pre-dinner or for happy hour.   It took me a while to warm up though, I must admit. I wasn't really a fan of their chai, which is one of my top picks for a coffee bar drink. Admittedly, I'm just not a coffee person. I like a super spicy chai and theirs is milder. But I kept coming and ordering down the list of their teas and am happy with their own blend of early grey and love my afternoon non-caffeinated vanilla rooibos tea.   I also always get their baked oatmeal, which comes in bar form. You definitely want to get it with your morning (or afternoon) drink because it's so delicious when it's warmed up and has a scoop of greek yogurt and honey drizzled on top. But that's just the start of their breakfast menu, and offer a full range of all the faves.   But let's move on to the cocktails. They have a solid wine and beer list, as well as a couple different negroni variations, which are some of the best I've had around town. They've also recently expanded their cheese menu... If that doesn't sell you alone, I don't know what to do! Just go there and enjoy the atmosphere and a drink (alcoholic or non) and enjoy the lovely experience there!

Qj9inD5CbU-SDk8QttU1_g.text: Coffee, Cocktails, Wine, Beer, and artisanal local cheese and meats? What is this place? Heaven? I think so (especially if you grab a seat upstairs).  We were looking for a spot to take a break from our touring around Pittsburgh and wanted to get some drinks, coffee and maybe a snack before moving on. Most of our group got craft cocktails, and were very impressed with the quality and tastes.  My friend and I decided to be fancy and bought a bottle of wine and the 5x5 meat and cheese board (5 artisanal local cheeses and 5 cured meats, also locally sourced/made). Given our choices of meats and cheeses we asked their in house Sommelier to help us pick a bottle that would pair well. She recommended we go with the Cultivate Pinot Noir and wow! What an amazingly easy drinking, clean finishing wine, and when paired with the meat and cheese....well I could have just stayed there all day long.  Lots of main floor seating but we ended up in the loft space overlooking the rest of the venue, and it was a perfect spot!  Big fan of this place, I'd definitely come back for coffee and baked treats next time!  Eatcrest Out

photos.caption: Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. View from the top
Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Coffee roaster

fayOIq1WQreGs6Kn1O7izw.text: I love this place, just not when it's stupid hot and humid out haha. The open front is awesome just not at those times :p  Great staff and great coffee. It's a cool lunch date spot or business meeting location. I buy coffee to take to my second home in N.Y. every time I'm there.  Pricy, but IMHO you can't go cheap on your make-up, hair, nails, or home brew coffee! Buy it!

photos.caption: Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Worth the $16
Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Worth the $16
Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fierce ginger

fZU8Gh0ki_zH6HcJaYzvmg.text: Hidden gem on Smallman street, I just hope they have enough financial backing to ride out all the construction going on...  These owners quit corporate America to follow their dream of owning a coffee shop. How cool is that?  They are very personable & passionate about their products and seem to do anything it takes to make their customers happy.  The space is plenty big for a small acoustic performance, poetry slam night, trivia night, etc. and once it cools down enough to leave the front garage door rolled up, you'll get that fresh air feel in a cozy shop.    Give this place a try if you're looking for a cool, hip, chill place to hang out for a few hours...

photos.caption: Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Their cool coffee roaster...
Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Roll up garage door for temperate days (it&#39;s super humid out so doors stay closed)
Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Art space on the walls...  come find that Warhol in the making...!

1p3kZGN41rw80Huuzelctw.text: Great coffee and tea - plus a nice selection of lite items for lunches or snacks/breakfast. The staff is excellent- really makes you feel welcome.

2-dDsegM07axKLbsWWbUng.text: What a cute place!! I'm kicking myself for never hitting up this coffee and tea (and so much more) spot before!! I attended a Yelp event here and it was wonderful. The space itself is spacious, gorgeous and roomy. The staff is very friendly, knowledgeable and welcoming. I liked learning about the process on how they roast their coffee beans.  Let's talk about the menu!! So extensive and enticing!! I can't wait to come back and try so many more of the menu items from waffles to paninis!! The wine I had at this particular event was very tasty and different. Cheers!! They also have a great selection of beers and cocktails that I look forward to trying more of on another visit.

photos.caption: Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

lduzHDh3LlVvQyr0L-Ruzg.text: This is the way a coffee house should be. Period. Customer service was exceptional. Their menu was amazing. Their variety is extraordinary. The food was fantastic. Are you detecting a pattern? De Fer does it all and does it all right! I've had their coffee, their tea, their paninis, desserts and waffles. Those waffles...wow! I do not like sweet things. These fit the bill. The homemade whipped cream was not at all sweet. A light touch of cinnamon, fruit and syrup made this a dish you will crave. I don't normally like coffee, but if I lived near De Fer, I would become addicted. They roast their own beans and offer various ways of creating a masterful cup of coffee. You will NOT be disappointed. Definitely a favorite of mine.

photos.caption: Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Ahhhhhh

6LcG52ZLp0R3wqZ5akRvxw.text: They are so incredibly nice here and they make these adorable babycinno's for the kids (steamed milk, a dusting of cocoa powder and whipped cream). They also have a whole selection of kids books for them to keep busy with, and any place that allows us to have coffee in peace with our children is a winner. They also have a corner with a kids kitchen and toys.

photos.caption: Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Babycinno
Photo of De Fer Coffee & Tea - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Babycinno.

N8dyaMPMMo4pSPEzQS6EUA.text: My friend and I visited De Fer a few weeks ago so she could use her coffee passport. I've had this place bookmarked for a while now so I was super excited when she asked me to join her.  With all the coffee shops popping up around Pittsburgh I have to say this was one of my favorites. This place truly has it all. Wine, cheese, food, coffee, etc. I ended up getting a specialty latte with a grilled cheese panini. Both were absolutely delicious!  The place itself can get pretty crowded so seating may be difficult on the weekends. Otherwise it was amazing. I look forward to giving it another try for a wine night.

5Jdra04PqGuv_bUoZCdD2Q.text: All for the experience! Coffee art please!   What did I get 2 cups of flat white and coffee and cream waffles! Let's talk about the coffee shall we? I always always ask if they do coffee art! I never expect amazing art, but just enjoy seeing it. I am not mad if they don't do it. This place made me my first cup of flat white with coffee art and it was nicely done! For my second cup, he redid it cause it didn't look good! Very very impressed! The coffee and cream waffle was great as well! They sure know how to make them picture worthy! It wasn't too sweet, but definitely fresh made! Didn't really taste the coffee in the waffle but I loved it.  Environment Seems to be a warehouse turned into a shop. There is a garage door that opens so a lot of wind and sunlight comes into the space. Decent amount of seating available.  Niceness of the staff I cannot express how nice these people were! I told them not too much cream on my waffle but still needed to look picture worthy and they did it! I asked for coffee art and they delivered! Love love the service I received! Very friendly and fun staff!   Dollar The items were relatively inexpensive I thought. The flat white was $4 and the waffles were less than $10 (I forgot the real price)   Yes? Absolutely love this place! Waffles and flat whites all day long! If I am ever in Pittsburg again...  #WendyWanders
